business.headline: Bibek Debroy dies at 69: A visionary economist and policy reformer Bibek Debroy's life was marked by significant contributions to economic policy and classical literature, shaping India's intellectual landscape and leaving a lasting impact on future generations.

19 kg LPG commercial cylinders to get costlier from today. Check pricesThe prices of 19-kg commercial LPG cylinders have been revised across the country, including in metro cities like Delhi, Mumbai, Kolkata, and Chennai, effective November 1.

Sensex ends over 550 points lower, Nifty dips as IT stocks slideThe S&P BSE Sensex dropped by 553.12 points to close at 79,389.06, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 135.50 points, settling at 24,205.35. Broader market indices also declined as volatility weighed on investor sentiment across Dalal Street.

Explained: Why Cipla share price surged up to 10% todayCipla share price: The stock rose by 9.88% to reach a day high of Rs 1,557.45 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).  At 10:41 am, shares of Cipla were up 8.24% at Rs 1,534.25.

HDFC Bank's HDB Financial files Rs 12,500 crore IPO. Check detailsHDFC Bank, holding a 94.6% stake in HDB Financial, will sell shares worth up to Rs 10,000 crore, while HDB Financial plans to issue fresh shares totalling Rs 2,500 crore, as outlined in the filing.
Diwali fireworks missing from Dalal Street as Sensex, Nifty fall The S&P BSE Sensex was down 199.13 points to 79,743.05 at 10:07 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 126 points to 24,340.85.

Paytm lights up Noida skies with dazzling Diwali drone showPaytm celebrated Diwali with a dazzling drone show at its Noida headquarters, featuring messages like "Happy Diwali" and "Paytm karo" in the night sky.

Sensex, Nifty snap 2-day rally as dull Q2 earnings disrupt momentum The BSE Sensex fell 0.5% to close at 79,966, while the NSE Nifty 50 index declined by the same margin to 24,350, as market sentiment weakened due to ongoing foreign selling and lacklustre corporate earnings.
StoxBox's Diwali picks: 5 stocks to light up your portfolioGet ready to brighten your portfolio this Diwali with these five promising stocks that are expected to deliver strong future performance.

Falling behind in AI race has cost Samsung $122 billion: Report Samsung has lost $122 billion in market value since July, a tumble of 32% that makes it the largest decline among global chipmakers this year.
Elcid's 66,92,535% surge makes it India's most expensive stock, surpassing MRFElcid Investments, based in Mumbai, is a non-banking financial company (NBFC) with a strong connection to Asian Paints.

Adani Enterprises, Adani Ports: Why Adani stocks are gaining todayAdani Enterprises shares rose 4.42% to Rs 2,974.50 on the National Stock Exchange (NSE) at 11:41 am, while APSEZ saw a 2.62% lift to Rs 1,408.65. All other Adani Group companies also traded in the green, supported by these positive cues.

RBI's 102-tonne gold haul this Dhanteras: What's behind the move?The RBI recently relocated 102 tonnes of gold from the Bank of England's vaults to secure facilities within India as it now hold a total of 855 tonnes in reserves.

Explained: Why Maruti Suzuki share price gained over 2% despite weak Q2 resultsMaruti Suzuki's quarterly report revealed a 17% year-on-year decline in net profit to Rs 3,103 crore, falling short of market expectations.

Sensex, Nifty in red as Q2 earnings dampen Diwali spirit; Adani stocks gainThe NSE Nifty 50 dropped 0.24% to 24,411.9 points, while the BSE Sensex declined 0.28% to 80,142.11 by 9:57 am. Seven out of the 13 major sectors showed losses, while small-cap and mid-cap indices performed better, rising 1% and 0.5%, respectively.

Afcons Infrastructure IPO allotment: Step-by-step guide to check status Afcons Infrastructure allotment: Investors can check their allotment status online. They can log in to either the BSE website or the website of Link Intime India Private Ltd, the registrar for the issue.

Afcons Infrastructure Day 3: Check latest subscription, GMP sees dip  The Afcons Infrastructure IPO comprises a fresh issue of 2.7 crore shares valued at Rs 1,250 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of 9.03 crore shares worth Rs 4,180 crore.

Muhurat trading 2024: Expert tips to maximise your Diwali returnsMuhurat trading is a unique session conducted by Indian stock exchanges on Diwali, rooted in the belief that this 'auspicious hour' is a time to attract prosperity.

Adani Enterprises Q2 results: Profit surges 664% YoY to Rs 1,742 croreThe company reported a net profit of Rs 1,742 crore in the July-September quarter, up from Rs 228 crore in the same period last year.

Sensex, Nifty pare losses to end higher as banking stocks gainThe S&P BSE Sensex rose 363.99 points to 80,369.03 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 127.70 points to settle at 24,446.85. Most of the broader market indices, including smallcap and midcaps, staged a stronger recovery.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Pak collecting information on J&K's Chenab Bridge at China's behest: SourcesThe Chenab Bridge, celebrated as the world's tallest railway bridge, recently began trials and is expected to enhance connectivity between Jammu and Kashmir and the rest of the country.

Bibek Debroy, economist and PM Modi's economic council chief, dies at 69Bibek Debroy, widely recognised for shaping economic policies, is also known for his translations of classical Sanskrit texts, including the Mahabharata and the Gita.

Delhi man, nephew shot dead on Diwali night, murders caught on CCTVDiwali celebrations turned tragic for a family when two armed men shot dead a 40-year-old man and his 16-year-old nephew at their home, while his 10-year-son was injured in Delhi.

Donald Trump will fix this: Elon Musk on Perplexity AI CEO's green card delayElon Musk, underscoring that it had become hard for highly talented people to come to America legally, said Donald Trump would 'fix it' if he won the presidential election.

Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3 review: Kartik Aaryan delivers brave message in horror-comedyReleased-Fri Nov 01, 2024Kartik Aaryan's Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3 is not just about horror or comedy, but it also holds an important message and tries to present it in the most sensitive way possible.

1 arrested for firing outside singer AP Dhillon's Canada home, another on the runThe arrested accused has been identified as 25-year-old Abjeet Kingra of Winnipeg, the police said, adding that he has been charged with "discharge of a firearm with intent and arson."

Kamala ignored Hindus: Trump condemns violence against minorities in BangladeshFormer US President Donald Trump condemned the "barbaric violence" against Hindus in Bangladesh and slammed Kamala Harris and Joe Biden in his Diwali message, saying they "ignored" them across the world and in America.

Amaran box office Day 1: Sivakarthikeyan records career-best openingAmaran, which released on October 31, registered a career-best opening for actor Sivakarthikeyan. The film earned over Rs 20 crore nett in India on its opening day.

Sathyabama's RISE - Building a Stronger FutureSathyabama Institute of Science and Technology stands out as a beacon of educational excellence and social responsibility. Under the visionary leadership of Chancellor Dr. Mariazeena Johnson, this institution is redefining what it means to be a premier university in India, transforming lives through both world-class education and impactful community initiatives.

Devender Rana, BJP's voice in Jammu, dies; Omar Abdullah's moving tributeUnion Minister Jitender Singh's younger brother Devender Singh Rana died at the age of 59 in Faridabad due to prolonged illness. He was a BJP MLA from Nagrota in Jammu region and his last rites may be held on Friday.

BJP MLA is Maharashtra's wealthiest candidate, assets rose by 575% in 5 yearsBJP MLA Parag Shah has disclosed net assets worth over Rs 3,300 crore, marking a 575% increase over the past five years. In the 2019 Assembly elections, Shah's net assets were worth Rs 550.62 crore.

On Singham Again release day, a look at contemporary films that explored RamayanaRohit Shetty's Singham Again, released on November 1, incorporateed Ramayana themes amidst a star-studded cast. Ajay Devgn, Kareena Kapoor, and others play roles inspired by the epic, adding a mythological twist to the narrative. Let's take a look at other films that have been inspired from the Ramayana.

Isro launches analogue mission in Ladakh to simulate life outside EarthThe mission aims to simulate life in an interplanetary habitat, addressing the challenges that future astronauts may encounter.

Singham Again-Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3 release Live Updates: Major box office clashSingham Again vs Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3 Release Live Updates: Ajay Devgn and Kartik Aaryan's films will compete against each other at the box office today, November 1. Stay tuned with India Today Digital for advance box office reports, public opinion, celeb reactions, and more on both films.
Apple CEO Tim Cook's Diwali post features pic shot by Delhi photographer Apple CEO Tim Cook shared a post on Diwali that featured a picture of diyas taken by Delhi-based photographer Rohit Vohra.

India's silent epidemic: What's killing our students? Surging suicides in campuses, driven by relentless academic pressure and inadequate mental health support, expose the deep-rooted flaws in the educational and societal frameworks

Industrial alcohol: How Supreme Court made it 'happy hours' for statesThe 8:1 ruling will enable states to curb misuse of industrial alcohol and boost their revenue even as the dissenting judge has flagged regulatory and economic concerns

Pics: Amy Jackson announces pregnancy with husband Ed WestwickAmy Jackson and Ed Westwick are expecting a child together. The couple, who married in August, have a strong bond with Amy's firstborn, Andreas, who shares a close relationship with Ed.

Europe's Proba-3 mission to arrive in India for launch by IsroThe two spacecraft, designed to create an artificial solar eclipse by precisely manoeuvring in orbit, left Redwire Space facilities in Belgium and will arrive at the Satish Dhawan Space Centre near Chennai for a launch scheduled on December 4, 2024.

Delhi becomes world's most polluted city as firecracker ban goes up in smokeRelentless burning of firecrackers by people on Diwali led to the worsening of air quality levels, with the AQI reaching close to 'severe' category at many places in Delhi.

Jasprit Bumrah gets his due as the most expensive retention at Mumbai Indians Star Indian fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah, widely recognized as a once-in-a-generation talent, has been retained by the Mumbai Indians for an impressive sum of Rs 18 crore.
Mahindra records highest-ever SUV sales in OctoberMahindra offers SUVs like the Bolero, Thar, Thar Roxx, Scorpio-N, Scorpio Classic, XUV 3XO, XUV700 and XUV400 (electric).

Pics: Alia Bhatt-Ranbir Kapoor step out for Diwali celebrations with RahaAlia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor stepped out on October 31 for Diwali celebrations with their daughter, Raha. The trio were clicked outside Neetu Kapoor's house.

Mohanlal, Prithviraj Sukumaran's Empuraan's release date out. New poster outDirector Prithviraj Sukumaran's L2: Empuraan, starring Mohanlal, is all set to release in theatres in March 2025. The makers announced the release date with a new poster.

sports.headline: India cancel intra-squad match to focus on net practice before Australia TestsIndia tour of Australia: Team India has opted to forgo a planned intra-squad match in favour of the additional net practice ahead of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy against Australia.

Watch: N'Golo Kante wins hearts by cleaning up pitch during Al-Ittihad gameN'Golo Kante continues to win fans over with his humble actions. During Al-Ittihad's match against Al-Ahli, Kante cleared the pitch of flags thrown by fans, showcasing his sportsmanship.

Sundar continues to haunt Rachin, dismisses NZ batter for 3rd successive timeIndia off spinner Washington Sundar dismissed Rachin Ravindra for the third consecutive time in the ongoing series by shattering his stumps on Day 1 of the second Test in Mumbai.

Pat Cummins a doubt as Australia to tour Sri Lanka for 2 Tests and 1 ODIAustralia's cricket team is set to tour Sri Lanka in early 2025 for a series of two Tests and one ODI. Captain Pat Cummins might miss this tour as he expects the arrival of his second child.

Ruben Amorim remains tight-lipped on Manchester United links: Will talk about itSporting Lisbon's coach Ruben Amorim has chosen not to comment on speculations linking him to the Manchester United managerial position. Amorim is all set to replace Erik ten Hag as the new United manager, according to British media.

Mukesh Kumar's sensational 6 for 46 helps India A bowl Australia A out for 195Mukesh Kumar delivered a sensational performance for India A, stepping up as their key player by claiming six wickets to bowl out Australia A for 197 in the first innings.

AUS-A vs IND-A: Captain Ruturaj Gaikwad suffers twin failures in MackayIndia A captain Ruturaj Gaikwad's struggles persisted as he was dismissed for just 5 runs in the second innings against Australia A. Ruturaj was dismissed for a duck in the first innings.

LaLiga clubs to help raise money for victims of Spain's flash floodsLaLiga and its clubs have initiated a fundraising campaign to assist the Red Cross in relief efforts after the flash floods in Spain. The campaign will be highlighted during match broadcasts and on social media platforms to maximise support.

IND vs NZ: Pune hero Mitchell Santner out of Mumbai Test due to injuryNew Zealand's hero in Pune, Mitchell Santner, has been ruled out of the Mumbai Test due to a side strain. Santner has been replaced by Ish Sodhi for the match.
Siraj replaces Jasprit Bumrah as India rest star pacer for 3rd TestIndia vs New Zealand: Young pacer Mohammed Siraj has replaced Jasprit Bumrah for the third and final Test against New Zealand.

1st ODI: West Indies hammer inexperienced England in series openerEvin Lewis played a commanding knock of 94 to guide West Indies to an eight-wicket win over England in the rain-affected first one-day international.

Rohit's selfless reaction on Mumbai Indians retention: Happy to be 4th pickRohit Sharma says he is happy after being retained by Mumbai Indians for INR 16.30 crore, making him the fourth-highest-paid player in the team.

Should Kohli be made RCB captain in IPL? Manjrekar strongly against it  IPL 2025: Sanjay Manjrekar said that Virat Kohli hasn't put in impressive enough performances to be made the captain of the Royal Challengers Bengaluru in the upcoming edition.

From Rishabh Pant to KL Rahul: Top 10 talking points from IPL RetentionsThe Indian Premier League retentions were announced on Thursday, October 31. There were several talking points starting from the snubbing of KL Rahul and Shreyas Iyer as captains and Rishabh Pant voluntarily entering the auction pool ending his 9-year stay at Delhi Capitals.

ECB announce central contracts: Jos Buttler and Ben Stokes sign two-year dealEngland cricket bolsters its future with multi-year central contracts for key players, including captains Ben Stokes and Jos Buttler. The ECB's latest contracts reinforce commitment and depth, recognising current talent and preparing emerging stars to shape England's next generation.

The ECB's latest contracts reinforce commitment and depth, recognising current talent and preparing emerging stars to shape England's next generation.

Rinku Singh to lead KKR? Defending champions pick surprise retentionIPL 2025: Shreyas Iyer was not retained by the Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) for the upcoming season, which means that they will have to find a new captain. Shreyas won them the title last season.

RCB believed in me at my lowest: Retained Yash Dayal aims to give 100%Yash Dayal expressed his gratitude as RCB retained him ahead of the IPL 2025 mega auction. The young pacer was retained for Rs 5 crore by the franchise.

From Ishan Kishan to Shreyas Iyer: Surprise releases before mega auction IPL 2025 Retentions: 46 players were retained by 10 franchises on Thursday. But there were some releases from the franchises that raised eyebrows. Among them was Shreyas Iyer, who won Kolkata Knight Riders the title last season.

Captain Hardik Pandya calls Mumbai Indians' retentions '5 fingers but one fist'Hardik Pandya, while addressing the MI fans, said that the players retained by the franchise are like '5 fingers but one fist'. Bumrah, Suryakumar, Hardik, Rohit and Tilak have been named as MI's retentions.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
